definition: knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs

sentences.english: But he is proud to show off the scars and stitch-marks that cover his belly.
sentences.chinese: 但他卻很樂意炫耀自己肚子上的刀疤和縫合的印記。

sentences.english: The hooligan stood leaning against the wall, cigarette between lips and scar on face.
sentences.chinese: 流氓斜倚着牆站着，嘴裏叼根菸，臉上一個刀疤。

sentences.english: The sexual allure of the facial scar has long puzzled psychologists.
sentences.chinese: 刀疤臉的性吸引力已經困擾了心理學家很長時間。

sentences.english: You can find deep knife scar across his face.
sentences.chinese: 你能發現橫過他臉部的深深的刀疤。

sentences.english: Andrew and his friend, a young sperm whale named Scar, were swimming together off the west coast of Dominica.
sentences.chinese: 安德魯和他那被稱作“刀疤”的抹香鯨朋友。

sentences.english: In a cave, Scar is praying.
sentences.chinese: 在一洞穴裏，刀疤正在捕食。

sentences.english: Zimbabwe is a scar on the conscience of the rest of southern Africa.
sentences.chinese: 津巴布韋是南部非洲良心上的一個刀疤。

sentences.english: The hooligan stood leaning against the wall, with a cigarette between his lips and a scar on his face.
sentences.chinese: 流氓斜倚着牆站着，嘴裏叼着一根菸，臉上一個刀疤。

sentences.english: Gothic tattoos run along her back, and deep knife scars trace her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 她的背上佈滿了哥特式紋身，肩頭上有深深的刀疤。

sentences.english: The accident left a scar on his forehead.
sentences.chinese: 那次事故在他的前額留下一刀疤。

definition: variant of 絡腮鬍子|络腮胡子[luo4 sai1 hu2 zi5]
bloody mouth (from devouring freshly killed prey)
variant of 榔頭|榔头[lang2 tou5]
